meta.description: Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge (Non-Schengen) at Frankfurt Airport (FRA), Terminal 1, Concourse B. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Air Canada Maple Leaf Lounge (Non-Schengen)
lounge.description: Air Canada's Frankfurt Maple Leaf Lounge is a serene, stylish oasis where eligible Air Canada and Star Alliance customers can rest, refuel or refresh before their flight in an inspiring, contemporary environment that is a celebration of Canadian design, artistry and craftsmanship.

reviews.content: Great lounge. In the newer Air Canada style. Beer on tap, great tarmac views. Much less crowded than other FRA lounges.
Not a lot of food but some premium spirits! Nice view of the tarmac.
My preferred lounge in FRA. Way less crowded than all LH lounges, nice selection of food and drinks (e.g. a waffle station), very nice atmosphere. The staff is very friendly. Perfect!

Nice interior and great views to the apron. 
Service could be better. The wine was too warm and the ice melted down. Friendliness off the reception could be better. No "bitte" or "danke" or "goodbye".
14 April 2018, came in expecting not so friendly service from the previous reviews, but am happy to report that I received and witnessed exactly the opposite! Great lounge to spend a few hours in.
I like this place, quieter than the Lufthansa lounges, fairly good food buffet and good clean shower/toilets. Good views, staff aren't very friendly but still good place to relax.
Extremely rude staff at the reception desk. You will be spoken to in a condescending and unprofessional way. Not the service you would expect of a supposed premium lounge.
Good breakfast spread, including smoothies. Yum! Veggie options, baked goods, and some hot options that aren't really my thing. Literally a "woodsy" ambiance, with stump tables and fire art.
No bar, no champagne. LHR lounge is better.
Nice lounge with good food and drink. They have four shower rooms so there is rarely a queue, unlike the LH lounges.
Between breakfast and lunch there's little to eat...sunny and calm - but I totally disagree that this lounge is so great and so much better than the Lufthansa ones. It's okay.
I was a bit surprised, this is a real nice lounge, the only downside was that I asked for a quiet place to make a phone call and they didn't have it.
Very quiet, pleasant and... Canadian :) Little food selection, very comfy showers.
Open all day to all *G travellers, yet empty unless there happens to an imminent AC departure. A true hidden gem, I feel like I shouldn't be giving away the secret.
I'll rate it as the best Star Alliance lounge of Frankfurt... good vegetarian options...better variety...good staff...
8 hour layover so trying all the facilities. Great fresh food(lunch), snacks and so very calm and quiet. Great view of the apron as well.
This is a nice, solid lounge. Breakfast is Continental only with the exception of pancakes and baked beans. No eggs whatsoever though, no bacon, no sausages. Excellent tarmac view though.
8 hour with my wife and kids (3,7,10 and 13), we got here at 6am and it has been fantastic. No reviews for families, great family lounge (just keep your kids under control). 25 euro each with it.
Food ok. Very comfy. Lots to read.
Excellent lounge, very good hot food selection, modern and clean, German beers on tap. Had friendly staff and very updated showers. This is a step up from the Lufthansa Business Lounge.
It was fully crowded when I tried it, the staff is friendly, there are some little spaces to get away from the noise. Good food but I preferred LH lounge for more food options and space.
Really good lounge, friendly welcome, solid food offering and Franziskaner on tap! What more can you ask for? A very peaceful break from the terminal and well worth a detour.
Best lounge in Frankfurt... Good service, good food, and very good facilities.
Good lounge. Nice food and beverages. Wifi is working fine, clean toilets. Friendly staff.
Nice lounge when it's not busy.
Excellent lounge! Comfortable and clean, very helpful staff, and a great selection of food and drink.
Cozy alternative to the LH options on the B concourse. 4 showers available, along with a solid food selection and friendly staff.
Friendly Canadian welcome and also helped with our flights. Relaxed, good food and drink - what more can you ask on a transfer? Cheers.
Great lounge at FRA. I used my United Club Card to gain access. Lots of space and the lounge chairs look very comfortable. If you have time in FRA and have a United Club Card, make the stop.
One of the best * lounges out there. Nice, comfy, quiet. Has a decent F&B selection. Much much much better than other LH alternatives in FRA.
Fairly new, very clean, nice shower and sleeping pods. Decent to good snack options.
Daybeds, good design and generally relaxing atmosphere. Worth staying.
Beautiful lounge. Not opulent like some of the Asian lounges, but far ahead of everything else coming out of NA.
Spectacular lounge! Skip Lufthansa lounges on the B pier if you're flying a Star carrier in business class from those gates. Great choice for Singapore Airlines, which departs from the B pier.
Very nice and comfy lounge. A nice selection of food and desserts. Clean and wifi was good.
Friendly staff, child friendly, nice snacks with a German feel and Franziskaner weissbier. A few loungers to snooze on if you can get one. Great showers.
Just opened Oct 2013. Good service, nice food, not that large but most people are in Lufthansa Senator anyway! Nice desserts (try the jelly and the freshly baked cookies!) Nice smiley service too.
This is a spotless, never-crowded lounge that also has friendly staff. Definitely worth the detour.
This is a the new Maple Leaf Lounge in FRA. It has an European flair.
A friendly, courteous staff await you in this lounge!

location.terminalDirections: Next to Gate A13, Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop.
Near Gate A26, proceed one level up to the entrance.
Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, next to Gate A13.
Level 2, opposite the Duty Free Shop, towards Gate A50.
Located behind Airport Entrance 13 (Tor 13) when arriving by car.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B24-B28 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
After Passport Control, proceed towards Gates B44-B48 and take the lift or stairs to the lounge entrance.
Departure Area B, next to Gate B22.
Departure Area B, opposite Gate B42, next to Gate B43.
Outside of Passport Control and Security Checkpoint, Arrival Area B, immediately behind the Baggage Claim.
Landside, between Concourses B and C on the Gallery Level, next to the Travel Market (Reisemarkt).
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gates C14-C15.
After Passport Control but before final Security Checkpoint, Departure Area C, near Gate C14 and Gate C15.
Level 4, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
Level 3, opposite the Duty Free Shop towards Gate Z50.
